Just wanted to bring attention to the bookstore for anyone who hasn't
visit=
ed it yet, or for people who haven't visited it in a while.  With
well over=
 100 books on Japan and Japanese history, it should be able
to handle all o=
f your Japanese history and jidaigeki needs.  It's
powered by Amazon.com, a=
nd for every book sold, a small percentage
from amazon.com goes towards the=
 website.

http://astore.amazon.com/samurai-20

Here are the sections:

Sen=
goku and Kamakura:
http://astore.amazon.com/samurai-20?_encoding=3DUTF8&nod=
e=3D1

http://astore.amazon.com/samurai-20?_encoding=
=3DUTF8&node=3D3

ing=3DUTF8&node=3D2

http://astore.amazon.com/samurai-20?_encod=

Samurai Fiction (Historical Fiction)
http://astore.ama=
zon.com/samurai-20?_encoding=3DUTF8&node=3D5

Samurai Cinema (DVDs and book=
s on Japanese film)
http://astore.amazon.com/samurai-20?_encoding=3DUTF8&no=
de=3D6

Modern Japanese Fiction (within the last 30 years or so, mostly cur=
rent)
http://astore.amazon.com/samurai-20?_encoding=3DUTF8&node=3D7

Modern=
 Japanese non-fiction (Nonfiction on post-WWII Japan)
http://astore.amazon.=
com/samurai-20?_encoding=3DUTF8&node=3D8

Japanese Politics and Business:
h=
ttp://astore.amazon.com/samurai-20?_encoding=3DUTF8&node=3D9

Also, Samurai=
 Archives forum member Les Paterson has recently

rested in:

Thanks, a=
nd enjoy the selection!
